info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 9 at 1:00AM CDT until May 9 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron.
* WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Of Brownsville, Southmost, Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Rivera High School, El Jardin Elementary School, Perkins Middle School, Brownsville South Padre Island International Airport, North Brownsville Little League, Gonzalez Elementary School, Villa Pancho, Southmost Elementary School, Lopez High School, Brownsville Public Library Southmost Branch, Brownsville Fire Department Station Six, Gallegos Elementary School, Besteiro Middle School and Hanna High School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING
